title: Border Ghost Stories
author: Pease, Howard
snippet: The Border hounds had gone right away up Redewater after an old dog foxthey had picked up on the rocks beside the Doure; twice had he circledthe Doure, then setting his mask westwards had crossed the Rede, and,turning right-handed, made straight for Carter Fell.

title: Border Ghost Stories
author: Pease, Howard
snippet: The Border hounds had gone right away up Redewater after an old dog foxthey had picked up on the rocks beside the Doure; twice had he circledthe Doure, then setting his mask westwards had crossed the Rede, and,turning right-handed, made straight for Carter Fell.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: It consists of two branches,the North and South Tyne, which descending from the north and south-west, uniteat Hexham, the former rising behind CrossFell, in the south-western boundary of thecounty, and the latter in the hills to thesouth of the Carter Fell, receiving at Bellingham a considerable stream from theCarter, termed the Reed.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Its shape is that of an irregular trapezium or rhomboid, whose largestdiameter stretches from the mouth of theTweed to the south-eastern extremity ofCumberland, and its transverse from themouth of the Tyne to its northern source,near the top of the Carter Fell, being about65 miles from north to south, and 50 milesfrom east to west.
